revision.text:
[[File:Aars water tower.jpg|thumb|Aars water tower|200px]] '''Aars water tower''' is a [[water tower]] located in [[Aars]] in [[Himmerland]], [[Denmark]]. The tower is built right in the middle of a very old water tank from where the city's original water supply went out. As it sounds, it was Aars's [[water tower]]. The building has many beautiful handicrafts. In the past the tower used to have a neon logo on top and the logo on top was the [[Cimbrian bull]] from Aars and [[Aars Municipality]] coat of arm/shild, but it was taken down. The tower was also a shop where you could buy yarn and many other things like tea cups. But the shop moved away from the tower.<ref>{{cite web|title=Aars Vandtårn|url=http://www.aars.dk/aars-vandtaarn|website=Aars.dk}}</ref>
==References== <references />
{{Coord|56|48|18.3|N|9|31|21.1|E|type:landmark_region:DK_dim:11|display=title}}
[[Category:Water towers in Denmark]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Vesthimmerland Municipality]]

{{Infobox building | name=Anglo-Russian Hospital | image=Dmitri Palace.jpg | caption=Dmitri Palace | coordinates = {{coord missing|Russia}} }} The '''Anglo-Russian Hospital''' was a hospital in [[Petrograd]] set up during the [[First World War]]. It was called 'The (British) Empire's Gift to Our Russian Allies' and was founded in 1915 and was closed in 1918.
Lady [[Muriel Paget]] and Lady Sybil Grey helped raise the funds to keep the hospital, located in what is now the [[Beloselsky-Belozersky Palace]], running and set up several [[field hospital]]s along the [[Eastern Front (World War I)|Eastern Front]]. Pioneering [[neurosurgeon]] [[Geoffrey Jefferson]] served here for about 18 months between 1916-1918. The hospital was visited by [[Alexandra Feodorovna (Alix of Hesse)|Tsarina Alexandra]] and her daughters, and [[Prince Felix Yusupov]] is reported to have had to have a fish bone removed from his throat here a few hours after the murder on [[Rasputin]].<ref>Harmer, Michael, ''The Forgotten Hospital'', Springwood Books, 1982, p.117</ref> The hospital closed not long after the [[October Revolution]] and the staff were evacuated to [[England]].
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Hospitals in Russia]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Saint Petersburg]] [[Category:Russia–United Kingdom relations]]

{{Infobox civilian attack | title = Atlantis Plastics shooting | image = Wesley Neal Higdon.jpg | image_size = 200px | caption = Wesley Neal Higdon | location = [[Henderson, Kentucky|Henderson]], [[Kentucky]], [[United States]] | coordinates = | date = {{start date|2008|6|25}} | time = {{circa}} 12:00 a.m. | timezone = [[Central Time Zone (North America)|CDT]] | type = [[Mass murder]], [[murder-suicide]] | fatalities = 6 (including the perpetrator) | injuries = 1 | perp = Wesley Neal Higdon | weapons = [[Hi-Point Model JHP]] [[.45 ACP|.45-caliber]] [[semi-automatic pistol]] }}
The '''Atlantis Plastics shooting''' was an incident of [[mass murder]] that took place at an [[Atlantis Plastics]] [[factory]] in [[Henderson, Kentucky|Henderson]], [[Kentucky]], [[United States]] on June 25, 2008. The gunman, 25-year-old Wesley Neal Higdon, shot and killed five people and critically injured a sixth person before taking his own life.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hCQpscfc_M8JtSecCWwa2c9zp7mQD91H5ONG0 |publisher=[[Associated Press]] |first=Ryan |last=Lenz |title=6 dead in Henderson, Ky., plastics plant shooting|date=2008-06-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080628081721/http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hCQpscfc_M8JtSecCWwa2c9zp7mQD91H5ONG0 |archivedate=June 28, 2008 }}</ref> The shooting is the worst in the history of [[Henderson County, Kentucky]] in terms of casualties, surpassing triple homicides occurring in 1799 and 1955.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.courierpress.com/news/2008/jun/25/shooting-worst-homicide-here/?gleaner=1/|publisher=''[[Henderson Gleaner]]''|date=2008-06-26|first=Beth|last=Smith|title=Rampage at Atlantis Plastics ends with six dead}}</ref>
==Details== Henderson police said that the shooter, who had a reputation for being difficult, had argued with supervisor Kevin Taylor and was being escorted out of the factory by the supervisor. The shooter apparently retrieved a handgun, shot the supervisor, then went back into the factory and shot five co-workers before turning the gun on himself.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=5242853&page=1|publisher=ABC News|date=2008-06-25|first=Russell|last=Goldman|title=Six Killed in Factory Shooting, Including Gunman}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.courier-journal.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20080625/NEWS01/80625001|publisher=''[[The Courier-Journal]]''|date=2008-06-25|title=Factory rampage that kills 6 may have been planned|first=Jason|last=Riley}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/marketsNews/idUSN2542255220080625|publisher=[[Reuters]]|title=Six dead in Kentucky factory shooting|date=2008-06-25 | first=Michael | last=Conlon}}</ref> Subsequent reports indicate that Taylor had reprimanded Higdon twice before the shooting, once for talking on his [[cell phone]] too much and for not wearing safety glasses, then later for an altercation with co-worker Joshua Hinojosa at a [[convenience store]] across the street from the factory.
The victims were all shot with a [[Hi-Point Model JHP]] [[.45 ACP|.45-caliber]] [[pistol]]. Taylor was apparently shot by Higdon outside the factory, then four more workers in the factory's break room, and finally Hinojosa from behind on the factory floor.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.courierpress.com/news/2008/jun/26/rampage-atlanits-plastics-ends-six-dead/|publisher=''[[Henderson Gleaner]]''|date=2008-06-26|first=Frank|last=Boyett|title=Shooting worst homicide here}}</ref> Higdon then committed suicide.
==Victims==
===Deceased=== * Wesley Neal Higdon, gunman, 25, of [[Henderson, Kentucky|Henderson]] * Joshua Hinojosa, co-worker, 28, of [[Sebree, Kentucky|Sebree]] * Trisha Mirelez, co-worker, 25, of Sebree * Israel Monroy, co-worker, 29, of Henderson * Kevin G. Taylor, supervisor, 40, of [[Dixon, Kentucky|Dixon]] * Rachael Vasquez, co-worker, 26, of Sebree
===Injured=== * Noelia Monroy, co-worker, of Henderson
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Atlantis Plastics Shooting}} [[Category:2008 in Kentucky]] [[Category:2008 mass shootings in the United States]] [[Category:2008 murders in the United States]] [[Category:Attacks in the United States in 2008]] [[Category:Crimes in Kentucky]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Kentucky]] [[Category:Filmed killings]] [[Category:Henderson County, Kentucky]] [[Category:June 2008 events]] [[Category:Massacres in the United States]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2008]] [[Category:Mass shootings in Kentucky]] [[Category:Mass shootings in the United States]] [[Category:Murder in Kentucky]] [[Category:Murder–suicides in Kentucky]] [[Category:Workplace violence in the United States]]

{{unreferenced|date=February 2014}}
'''Bangladesh Society of Microbiologists''' (BSM) is an association of Bangladeshi [[Microbiologist]]s.
==History== The Bangladesh Society of Microbiologists was established in 1976 by a few researchers and intellectuals from [[Bangladesh]]. From the period of its establishment, it has emerged as the largest association of intellectuals and researchers in Bangladesh.{{Citation needed|date=March 2012}} The founder president of the society was Major General M. R. Choudhury ([[Mahmudur Rahman Choudhury]]) who died on June 24, 1999.
==Founders== *Professor Aminul Islam, *Major General M.R. Chowdhury, *Dr. K.M.S. Aziz, *Dr. Imdadul Huq, *Dr. Farida Huq, *[[Naiyyum Choudhury|Professor Naiyyum Choudhury]] * Professor Khairul Bashar, * Professor M.R. Khan, * Major General Matiur Rahman, * Mr. G.K. Joardar, * Professor S.S. Qadri, * Professor Mamun Rashid Chowdhury, * Dr. Mohosin Patwary, * Dr. Fazle Rabbi, * Dr. Ansar Ali, * Dr. Shahjahan Kabir, * Dr. Syeda Quadsia Akhter (late), * Dr. Syed Ashraf Ahmed, * [[Firdausi Qadri|Dr. Firdausi Qadri]], * Dr. [[Mohammed Rahmatullah]], * Dr. M. Showkat Ali, * Dr. M.A. Rahim and others.
==Web site== * [http://www.bsm.org.bd/index.php Bangladesh Society of Microbiologist]
[[Category:Microbiology organisations]] [[Category:Science and technology in Bangladesh]] [[Category:Medical and health organisations based in Bangladesh]] [[Category:Learned societies of Bangladesh]]

revision.comment: removed controverted speculation that Ramos "never gave a hint" that he would act on his threats. His victims had called police on multiple occasions, so Ramos had given them "hints."
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Use American English|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = Capital Gazette shooting | partof = [[Gun violence in the United States]] | image = | image_upright = | alt = right | caption = | map = {{Location map | USA Maryland # USA | float = center | width = 250 | label = Anne Arundel County | background = | coordinates = {{coord|38.9942|-76.5436}} }} | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = | location = 888 Bestgate Road
[[Annapolis, Maryland]] 21401
[[United States]] | target = | coordinates = {{coords|38|59|39|N|76|32|37|W|display=inline,title}} | date = June 28, 2018 | time = ~2:34 p.m. | timezone = [[Eastern Time Zone|EDT]] | type = [[Mass shooting]] | fatalities = 5 | injuries = 2 | victims = | susperp = Jarrod Ramos, age 38 | motive = | weapons = 12-gauge pump-action shotgun{{cite web |title=Maryland Shooting Suspect Had Long-Running Dispute With Newspaper |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/29/us/jarrod-ramos-annapolis-shooting.html |website=The New York Times |accessdate=June 30, 2018}} | convicted = | verdict = | convictions = | charges =Five counts of first-degree murder Multiple counts of attempted first degree murder }} On June 28, 2018, a [[mass shooting]] occurred at the offices of ''[[The Capital]]'', a newspaper serving [[Annapolis, Maryland|Annapolis]], [[Maryland]]. The gunman, Jarrod Ramos, shot and killed five employees with a [[shotgun]]. Two others were injured while trying to escape. Ramos was arrested shortly after and is currently imprisoned while awaiting trial for the shooting. The newspaper published an article in 2011 about Ramos being put on probation for harassing an acquaintance from high school through social media and email. Ramos, angered by the article, brought a [[defamation]] lawsuit against ''The Capital''; a judge later dismissed the suit. Ramos is alleged to have sent enraged letters and messages to the newspaper's offices about his threats to attack the office and its staff; no legal action was taken after the threats were received.{{cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/capital-gazette-shooting-suspect-sent-threatening-letters-newsroom-massacre-n888501|title=Capital Gazette shooting suspect sent chilling letters before newsroom massacre: police|publisher=NBC News|date=2 July 2018}} Capital Gazette Communications, owned by [[Tronc]] through its subsidiary the Baltimore Sun Media Group, publishes the daily ''[[The Capital]]'' and the ''[[Maryland Gazette]]'' newspapers and the weeklies ''[[Bowie, Maryland|Bowie]] Blade-News'' and ''Crofton-West County Gazette''. Its offices are located at 888 Bestgate Road in [[Parole, Maryland|Parole]], an unincorporated area of [[Anne Arundel County, Maryland|Anne Arundel County]] just outside Annapolis (the place name assigned by the [[United States Postal Service|U.S. Postal Service]] for addresses in this area).{{cite news|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-gazette-shooting-20180628-story.html|title=Shooting reported at Capital Gazette newspaper in Annapolis, staff say|last=Rector|first=Kevin|date=June 28, 2018|work=[[The Baltimore Sun]]|accessdate=June 28, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/about/cg-about-us-20140708-htmlstory.html|title=About Us|date=July 4, 2014|website=Capital Gazette|publisher=Capital Gazette Comunications|accessdate=June 28, 2018}} ==Incident== The [[Anne Arundel County Police Department]] reported that the shooting began around 2:34 pm ([[Eastern Time Zone|EDT]]), resulting in five fatalities and the wounding of several other victims.{{cite news |last=Hensley |first=Sarah Beth |date=June 28, 2018 |title=Injuries reported in active shooter incident at Capital Gazette building in Annapolis |url=https://wtop.com/anne-arundel-county/2018/06/active-shooting-incident-at-capital-gazette-building-in-annapolis/slide/1/ |publisher=[[WTOP-FM|WTOP]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}} The gunman barricaded the rear exit of the office to prevent people from escaping. Sources reported that the weapon was a "long gun" which would later be described as a 12-gauge pump-action [[shotgun]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/annapolis-shooting-five-dead-in-shooting-at-capital-gazette-newspaper-in-maryland-suspect-in-custody-2018-06-28-live-updates/|title=5 dead in shooting at newspaper building in Maryland, suspect in custody|access-date=June 29, 2018|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a21998213/annapolis-capital-gazette-shooting-jarod-ramos/|title=Every Newspaper Reporter Knows Jarrod Ramos|date=June 29, 2018|work=Esquire|access-date=June 29, 2018|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/gunman-kills-5-in-attack-targeting-maryland-newspaper/2018/06/28/7994d72c-7b33-11e8-ac4e-421ef7165923_story.html|title=Police called suspect in newsroom rampage no threat in 2013|last=Witte|first=Brian|date=June 29, 2018|work=Washington Post|access-date=June 30, 2018|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286}} The gunman used the weapon to shoot repeatedly after shooting out the office's glass door. Phil Davis, a courts and crime reporter at the site of the shooting for ''The Capital'', tweeted that the gunman "shot through the glass door to the office and opened fire on multiple employees".{{cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/maryland-newspaper-shooting/index.html|title=Shooting at Maryland newspaper|author1=Meg Wagner|author2=Veronica Rocha|date=June 28, 2018|publisher=CNN|accessdate=June 28, 2018|author3=Brian Ries}} Davis also described the newspapers' offices as a "war zone" after the shooting and described hearing the gunman reload. He said the male gunman was alone.{{cite news|url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/bs-md-gazette-shooting-20180628-story.html|title=Five dead, others 'gravely injured' in shooting at Capital Gazette newspaper in Annapolis|last1=Rector|first1=Kevin|date=June 28, 2018|work=Capital Gazette|accessdate=June 28, 2018}} During a pause in the shooting, survivors moved to take refuge between filling cabinets, with some claiming victim Wendi Winters confronted the gunman, causing the pause.{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/07/10/us/wendi-winters-capital-gazette-trnd/index.html|title=When the gunman attacked the Capital Gazette office, one staffer charged at him|last=CNN|first=Jessica Campisi and Saeed Ahmed,|work=CNN|access-date=2018-07-11}} One survivor stated that Winters charged the gunman with a trash can and recycling bin, screaming at him, distracting him long enough for survivors to escape.{{Cite news|url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/news/annapolis/ac-cn-wendi-winters-20180706-story.html|title='Wendi Winters saved my life': Capital Gazette staff say their fallen colleague charged the shooter|last=Ohl|first=Danielle|work=capitalgazette.com|access-date=2018-07-11|language=en-US}} Several injured victims were sent to the [[Anne Arundel Medical Center]] for treatment.{{cite news|url=https://www.apnews.com/01d23bc538ca4ae6b9b8feb3ef86f1fa/5-killed,-others-wounded-at-Maryland-newspaper-shooting|title=5 killed, others wounded at Maryland newspaper shooting|date=June 28, 2018|accessdate=June 28, 2018|publisher=[[Associated Press]]}} County police evacuated 170 people from the building to a reunification center set up at the nearby [[Westfield Annapolis]] shopping center.{{cite news|url=http://www.fox9.com/home/shots-fired-reported-near-westfield-annapolis-mall-police-say|title=Capital Gazette Shooting: 5 dead as active shooter opens fire in Annapolis, officials say|date=June 28, 2018|accessdate=June 28, 2018|publisher=[[KMSP-TV|KMSP 9]]}} The police reportedly had a 1-minute response time, and interviewed survivors in the criminal investigations unit of the Anne Arundel County Police Department.{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.com/news/20180706/beaver-falls-native-recounts-daughters-experience-surviving-capital-gazette-shootings|title=Beaver Falls native recounts daughter's experience surviving Capital Gazette shootings|last=Stonesifer|first=Jared|work=The Times|access-date=2018-07-11|language=en}} The police discovered the suspect underneath a desk in the office, and surveillance within the office documented the incident and helped identify Ramos as the perpetrator.{{Cite news|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bal-charging-documents-jarrod-ramos-20180629-htmlstory.html|title=Charging documents: Jarrod Ramos|last=Sun|first=Baltimore|work=baltimoresun.com|access-date=2018-07-13|language=en-US}} An indictment handed down on July 20 included five counts of first-degree murder, one count of attempted first-degree murder, six counts of first-degree assault, and 11 counts of the use of a firearm in the commission of a felony.{{Cite web|url=casesearch.courts.md.us/casesearch/inquiryDetail.jis?caseId=C02CR18001515&loc=608&detail_oc=ODYCRIM|title=Maryland Judiciary Case Search|last=|first=|date=|website=Maryland Judiciary Case Search|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=8/11/18}} == Victims == Five people were killed and several others were injured in the attack. Those killed were: * Gerald Fischman, age 61, columnist and editorial page editor of ''The Capital''{{cite web|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/bs-md-gerald-fischman-20180628-story.html|title=Capital Gazette shooting victim Gerald Fischman: Clever and quirky voice of a community newspaper|first=Erin|last=Cox|publisher=''Baltimore Sun''|accessdate=June 29, 2018}} * [[Rob Hiaasen]], age 59, assistant editor and weekend columnist of ''The Capital''{{cite web |last1=Marbella |first1=Jean |title=Capital Gazette editor Rob Hiaasen identified as victim of shooting at newspaper |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/bs-md-rob-hiaasen-20180628-story.html |website=baltimoresun.com |accessdate=June 29, 2018}} * John McNamara, age 56, sports reporter of ''The Capital''{{cite web|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/bs-md-john-mcnamara-20180628-story.html|title=Capital Gazette shooting victim John McNamara: Sports reporting was his dream job|first=Andrea K.|last=McDaniels|publisher=''Baltimore Sun''|accessdate=June 29, 2018}} and editor and primary reporter of ''The Bowie Blade-News''{{cite web |title=Bowie Mourns the Loss of John McNamara |url=http://cityofbowie.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=1786 |website=The City of Bowie |accessdate=June 30, 2018 |language=en}} * Rebecca Smith, age 34, sales assistant of Capital Gazette Communications{{cite web|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/bs-md-ar-rebecca-smith-20180628-story.html|title=Capital Gazette shooting victim Rebecca Smith: Recent hire loved spending time with family|first=Jessica|last=Anderson|publisher=''Baltimore Sun''|accessdate=June 29, 2018}} * Wendi Winters, age 65, community [[beat reporter]] of ''The Capital''{{cite web|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/bs-md-wendi-winters-20180628-story.html|title=Capital Gazette shooting victim Wendi Winters: A prolific writer who chronicled her community|first=Yvonne|last=Wenger|publisher=''Baltimore Sun''|accessdate=June 29, 2018}} According to the [[Committee to Protect Journalists]], the Capital Gazette shooting was one of only two incidents in which multiple [[List of journalists killed in the United States|journalists were killed in the United States]] since the organization began compiling data in 1992. The other incident was the [[murders of Alison Parker and Adam Ward]] during a live television interview in 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-journalist-killings-20180628-story.html|title=Fatal shooting of 5 at Capital Gazette is rare attack on U.S. journalists|last1=Duncan|first1=Ian|website=baltimoresun.com|accessdate=June 29, 2018}} == Suspect == {{Infobox criminal | name = Jarrod Warren Ramos | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1979|12|21}} | birth_place = [[Laurel, Maryland|Laurel]], [[Maryland]] | residence = [[Maryland]] | nationality = American | education = [[University of Maryland, College Park]] | criminal_charge = five counts of felony murder }} Jarrod Warren Ramos{{cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/maryland-shooting-jarrod-warren-ramos-38-named-as-suspect-after-five-killed-in-gun-attack-on-us-a3875031.html|title=Maryland shooting: Jarrod Warren Ramos, 38, named as suspect after five killed in gun attack on US newsroom|last=Morrison|first=Sean|publisher=''[[Evening Standard]]''|date=June 29, 2018|accessdate=June 29, 2018}}{{Cite news |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ramos-search-20180628-story.html |title=Sources identify suspect in Annapolis Capital shooting as Jarrod Ramos, who had long-running feud with paper |last=Duncan |first=Ian |date=June 28, 2018 |work=Baltimore Sun |access-date=June 28, 2018 |last2=Bogel-Burroughs |first2=Nicholas |language=en-US}}{{Cite news |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2018/06/29/suspect-in-maryland-newspaper-shooting-identified-as-jarrod-ramos.html |title=Suspect in Maryland newspaper shooting identified |last=Higgins |first=Tucker |date=June 28, 2018 |work=CNBC |access-date=June 28, 2018}} (born December 21, 1979), age 38, was captured by police and is in custody as a suspect, but he refused to identify himself.{{cite news |date=June 28, 2018 |title=5 dead in shooting at newspaper building in Maryland, suspect in custody |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/annapolis-shooting-five-dead-in-shooting-at-capital-gazette-newspaper-in-maryland-suspect-in-custody-2018-06-28-live-updates/ |publisher=[[CBS News]] |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=June 28, 2018}}{{cite news |date=June 28, 2018 |title=Annapolis shooting: Five killed in attack on US newspaper |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-44645986 |publisher=[[BBC News]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}} Early reports said that the gunman mutilated his fingertips to avoid identification,{{cite news |title=Annapolis shooting suspect damaged his fingertips to thwart identification, source says |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/annapolis-shooting-suspect-damaged-fingerprints-latest-updates-live-stream-today-2018-06-28/ |work=CBS News |date=June 28, 2018 |language=en}}{{cite news |title=Suspect's fingerprints appear to have been altered, sources say |url=https://www.cnn.com/us/live-news/maryland-newspaper-shooting/h_9a83464231837c41f32cfd654ae9d083 |work=CNN |date=June 28, 2018 |language=en}} but a law-enforcement official later stated that an issue with the fingerprint machine had caused the difficulties in identifying the suspect, and that his fingertips had not been mutilated.{{cite news |title=What we know about the Capital Gazette shooting suspect |url=http://abc7chicago.com/what-we-know-about-the-capital-gazette-shooting-suspect/3671384/ |work=ABC7 Chicago |date=June 28, 2018}} The suspect was also carrying a backpack with smoke bombs, [[Stun grenade|flashbang]] devices, and grenades. The police later announced that the attack had been targeted specifically at Capital Gazette Communications.{{cite news |last1=Bui |first1=Lynh |last2=Wiggins |first2=Ovetta |last3=Jackman |first3=Tom |date=June 28, 2018 |title=Five dead, gunman in custody after targeted shooting at Capital Gazette building in Annapolis, police say |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/heavy-police-activity-reported-around-capital-gazette-newsroom-in-annapolis/2018/06/28/32e0123e-7b05-11e8-93cc-6d3beccdd7a3_story.html?noredirect=on&utm_term=.eebd288eacaa |work=[[The Washington Post]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}}{{cite news |last1=Stanglin |first1=Doug |last2=Bacon |first2=John |last3=Cummings |first3=William |last4=Rossman |first4=Sean |date=June 28, 2018 |title=5 killed in 'targeted attack' on Capital Gazette newspaper, police say |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2018/06/28/shooting-annapolis-newspaper-suspect-custody-police-say/743150002/ |work=[[USA Today]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}} In a court filing, Ramos stated he had seen five mental health professionals for at least 75 visits before the shooting, and exhibited a pattern of threats.{{Cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2018/07/03/ramos-suspect-newspaper-killings-had-long-history-threats-mental-health-issues/753081002/|title=Capital Gazette shooting suspect seen as angry loner, obsessed with those who 'wronged' him|work=USA TODAY|access-date=2018-07-04|language=en}} Many of those around Ramos believed him to be a calculated, manipulative loner, who would become angry when things did not go his way, with those afflicted by him convinced he would one day hurt someone.{{Cite news|url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/news/for_the_record/ac-cn-ramos-yearbook-0708-story.html|title=Capital Gazette homicide suspect Jarrod Ramos was an 'outcast of the outcasts,' classmate says|last=Cook|first=Chase|work=capitalgazette.com|access-date=2018-07-08|language=en-US}} None of Ramos's immediate family responded to requests for comment and other relatives have stated that they have not had contact with him for several years.{{Cite news|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ramos-profile-20180705-story.html|title=Capital Gazette shooting suspect's anger flared, and fell silent. Then, police say, it exploded|last=Bogel-Burroughs|first=Ian Duncan, Nicholas|work=baltimoresun.com|access-date=2018-07-08|language=en-US}} === Legal issues relating to the attack === Ramos has been charged with five counts of [[First-degree murder (United States law)|first-degree murder]], and ordered to be held without bail after he was determined to be a flight risk and a danger to the community. In July 2018, records showed Ramos was also charged with [[Attempted murder|attempted first-degree murder]] of the survivors of the attack along with first-degree murder.{{Cite news|url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/news/for_the_record/ac-cn-ramos-hearing-0730-story.html#|title=Capital Gazette homicide charges come to court Monday|last=Cook|first=Chase|work=capitalgazette.com|access-date=2018-08-23|language=en-US}} He has also been placed on suicide watch while in custody of law enforcement.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Suspect-in-Capital-Gazette-Shooting-to-Appear-in-Court-486922321.html|title=Gunman Was Methodical, Blocked Victims' Escape: Prosecutor|work=NBC4 Washington|access-date=June 30, 2018|language=en}} During his bail hearing, Ramos did not speak the entire time. In July 2018, the case was assigned to Circuit Court Judge Laura S. Kiessling. On August 20, 2018 Ramos was seen in court for a brief hearing, where he pled not guilty to all charges, with a deadline of October 24 for his lawyers to enter a revised plea of [[Insanity defense|not criminally responsible]]. The trial date was set for January 15, 2019,{{Cite news|url=https://foxbaltimore.com/news/local/lawyers-for-capital-gazette-shooting-suspect-could-consider-insanity-plea|title=Lawyers for Capital Gazette shooting suspect could consider insanity plea|last=Rydell|first=John|work=WBFF|access-date=2018-08-23|language=en-US}} and was later delayed to June 3, 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.seattletimes.com/nation-world/man-accused-in-newspaper-shootings-to-face-trial-next-june/|title=Man accused in newspaper shootings to face trial next June|publisher=The Seattle Times|date=November 15, 2018|accessdate=November 28, 2018}} === Previous dispute with newspaper === In 2012, Ramos sued ''The Capital'' in a [[defamation]] case he brought over a 2011 newspaper article reporting on his guilty plea for [[Stalking|criminal harassment]].{{Cite news |url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/news/ph-ac-cn-jarrod-ramos-ruling-0923-20150922-story.html |title=Appellate court upholds ruling in favor of Capital-Gazette |last=Pratt |first=Tim |date=September 22, 2015 |work=Capital Gazette |access-date=June 28, 2018 |language=en-US}} After multiple appeals from Ramos, the defamation case against the newspaper was dismissed in 2015 by [[Prince George's County, Maryland|Prince George's County]] circuit court judge Maureen M. Lamasney, who ruled in favor of the paper because their reporting was based on publicly available records and Ramos had produced no evidence that the article was inaccurate. Lamasney wrote in her court opinion that Ramos' complaint was "a fundamental failure to understand what defamation law is, and more particularly, what defamation law is not". Former ''Capital'' editor and publisher Thomas Marquardt said Ramos began harassing the staff of the newspaper after the article on him was published in 2011. In 2013, Marquardt contacted the Anne Arundel County Police Department about Ramos' behavior, but the department did not pursue the report. Marquardt also consulted the newspaper's attorneys about filing a restraining order against Ramos, and recalled telling them, "This is a guy who is going to come in and shoot us." After his lawsuit against the newspaper was dismissed, Ramos opened a [[Twitter]] account, which he used to attack the newspaper and taunt its owners and staff.{{cite web |last1=Becket |first1=Stefan |title=Jarrod Ramos, 38, identified as suspect in Annapolis shooting |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jarrod-ramos-annapolis-shooting-suspect-identified-maryland-shooting-capital-gazette-today-2018-06-28/ |website=CBS News |accessdate=June 29, 2018 |language=en}} A former FBI senior profiler speculated that Ramos was "an injustice collector", whom she described as "someone who goes through life...collect[ing] injustices, real or imagined".{{cite web|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jarrod-ramos-annapolis-shooting-suspect-an-injustice-collector-former-fbi-profiler-says/|title=Annapolis shooting suspect "an injustice collector," former FBI profiler says|publisher=}} Ramos reportedly previously sent threatening letters to the newspaper's former attorney, to the [[Maryland Court of Special Appeals]], and to Charles Moylan, Jr., the appellate judge who had ruled against Ramos in his defamation case.{{cite news |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ramos-letters-20180702-story.html |title=Capital Gazette suspect allegedly mailed threatening letters before Thursday's shooting |publisher=''[[The Baltimore Sun]]'' |date=July 2, 2018 |first=Ian |last=Duncan |first2=Talia |last2=Richman}} === Other lawsuits === Ramos' use of the criminal-justice system as a form of attempting to get his way was seen in at least two other cases. When he was dismissed from his job at the [[Bureau of Labor Statistics]], over "suitability concerns", he sued the agency and won the case, yet was still dismissed from the agency. In 2009, a former classmate took out peace orders (used to prevent contact between people), followed by criminal harassment charges, which he lost. In an affidavit, the harassment victim wrote, "I am physically afraid of Mr. Ramos, and that he may cause me serious physical injury and/or death." === June 28 letters === On Thursday, June 28, police reported that Ramos sent letters to three people who had been involved in his defamation lawsuit, with a packet being received by ''The Capital's'' former attorney that included a letter addressed to Judge Moylan, who wrote the opinion upholding the dismissal of his defamation case. In it, he wrote, "Welcome, Mr. Moylan, to your unexpected legacy: YOU should have died...Friends forever, Jarrod W. Ramos." The letter continues; "I further certify I then did proceed to the office of respondent Capital-Gazette Communications...with the objective of killing every person present."{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2018/07/03/us/annapolis-capital-gazette-shooter-letter/index.html|title=Newspaper shooting suspect's letter says aim was 'killing every person present'|last=CNN|first=Mark Morales and Ray Sanchez,|work=CNN|access-date=2018-07-04}} One of the letters thought to have been written by the suspect was published by other news sources. ==Reactions== Police were also sent to the offices of ''[[The Baltimore Sun]]'', which owns Capital Gazette Communications, as a precaution, although no threat was registered there. The [[New York City Police Department]] also deployed [[counter-terrorism]] units to the headquarters of major news outlets in New York City as a precaution against similar attacks.{{cite news |last=Steinberg |first=Brian |date=June 28, 2018 |title=NYPD Sends Officers to New York Media Outlets After Annapolis Shooting |url=https://variety.com/2018/tv/news/annapolis-shooting-nypd-new-york-media-outlets-1202861115/ |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}} The [[Chicago Police Department]] took similar actions.{{cite news |date=June 28, 2018 |title=Police Sent To Media Outlets In Chicago After Maryland Newsroom Shooting |url=https://chicago.cbslocal.com/2018/06/28/police-sent-to-media-outlets-in-chicago-after-maryland-newsroom-shooting/ |publisher=[[WBBM-TV|CBS 2 Chicago]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}} === Political === [[President of the United States|President]] [[Donald Trump]] was briefed on the shooting and offered his thoughts and prayers by tweet.{{cite news |last=Shapiro |first=Emily |date=June 28, 2018 |title=5 dead in shooting at Annapolis newspaper: Officials |url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/shooting-reported-newspaper-annapolis-atf/story?id=56239257 |publisher=[[ABC News]] |accessdate=June 28, 2018}} He later declined to lower U.S. flags to [[half-staff]], as is custom for mass shootings, despite requests from Annapolis mayor [[Gavin Buckley]] and the lowering of Maryland flags by the [[Governor of Maryland]], [[Larry Hogan]].{{cite news |last=Ohl |first=Danielle |date=July 2, 2018 |title=Trump declines request to lower flags in memory of Capital Gazette shooting victims |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/annapolis/bs-ac-cn-flag-request-denied-20180702-story.html |work=Baltimore Sun |accessdate=July 2, 2018}} On July 3, the [[White House]] was reported to have permitted the lowering of the US flags on federal buildings for the day, with the President then issuing a proclamation for the flags to be lowered nationwide until sunset on July 3.{{Cite news|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/anne-arundel/ac-can-white-house-flag-half-staff-20180703-story.html|title=White House orders U.S. flags lowered for Capital Gazette victims after Annapolis mayor said initial request declined|last=Ohl|first=Danielle|work=baltimoresun.com|access-date=2018-07-04|language=en-US}} Some commentators have called the shooting an attack on the media, and framed it alongside comments by Trump that the "[[fake news]] media" (''[[The New York Times]]'', ''[[The Washington Post]]'', [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]], [[CBS]], [[CNN]], [[NBC News]]) are the "[[enemy of the people]]".{{cite news |last=Pope |first=Kyle |date=June 29, 2018 |title=The war against the press comes to the local newsroom |url=https://www.cjr.org/analysis/newspaper-shooting-maryland.php |work=[[Columbia Journalism Review]] |accessdate=June 29, 2018}}{{cite news |last=Mayfield |first=Mandy |date=June 28, 2018 |title=Journalists call out Trump for anti-press rhetoric following Annapolis newsroom shooting |url=https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/journalists-call-out-trump-anti-press-rhetoric-annapolis-capital-gazette-shooting |work=[[Washington Examiner]] |accessdate=June 29, 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Kirell |first1=Andrew |last2=Arciga |first2=Julia |title=Trump Now Says Journalists Should Be ‘Free From Fear’ After Previously Calling Them ‘Enemies of the People’ |url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/trump-now-says-journalists-should-be-free-from-fear-after-previously-calling-them-enemies-of-the-people |work=[[The Daily Beast]] |accessdate=June 30, 2018}} The Monday before the shooting, Trump used the same "enemy" phrase to describe "fake newsers" journalists.{{cite web |last1=Baynes |first1=Chris |title=Maryland shooting: Trump ducks questions over Capital Gazette killings, as president's attacks on journalists come into focus |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/maryland-shooting-trump-reaction-video-questions-capital-gazette-fake-news-journalists-killed-a8422451.html |work=[[The Independent]] |accessdate=7 July 2018}} The Sunday after the shooting, the staff of the ''Capital Gazette'' wrote: "We won't forget being called an enemy of the people".{{cite web |last1=Wise |first1=Justin |title=Capital Gazette staff: 'Keep reading, we've only just begun' |url=http://thehill.com/homenews/395051-capital-gazette-staff-keep-reading-weve-only-just-begun |publisher=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |accessdate=3 July 2018}} Days before, right-wing commentator [[Milo Yiannopoulos]] wrote that he "can't wait for vigilante squads to start gunning journalists down on sight" in text messages to reporters. After the shooting, Yiannopoulos said the texts were a just a joke.{{cite news |last=Gore |first=Leada |date=June 29, 2018 |title=Capital Gazette shooting: Milo Yiannopoulos says 'gunning down journalists' line was joke |url=https://www.al.com/news/index.ssf/2018/06/capital_gazette_shooting_milo.html |work=[[The Birmingham News]] |accessdate=June 29, 2018}}{{cite news |last=Fink |first=Jenni |date=June 28, 2018 |title=Milo Yiannopoulos Responds to Annapolis Capital Gazette Shooting: Vigilantes Shooting Journalists Comment Was a Joke |url=http://www.newsweek.com/milo-yiannopoulos-responds-annapolis-capital-gazette-shooting-vigilantes-1000641 |work=[[Newsweek]] |accessdate=June 29, 2018}} Governor Hogan tweeted that he was "[a]bsolutely devastated to learn of this tragedy in Annapolis", and asked residents to "heed all warnings and stay away from the area".{{cite news |title=Md. Gov. Hogan, Trump react to Capital Gazette shooting in Annapolis |url=https://wtop.com/anne-arundel-county/2018/06/md-gov-hogan-lawmakers-react-to-capital-gazette-shooting-in-annapolis/ |work=WTOP.com|date=June 28, 2018}} In a press conference, he praised local law enforcement for responding within 60 seconds. === Journalism === [[Justin Dearborn]], the chairman and CEO of Tronc, said: "We are focused now on providing our employees and their families with support during this tragic time. We commend the police and first responders for their quick response."{{cite web |title=tronc, Inc. Statement on Shooting in Annapolis, Maryland |url=https://www.nasdaq.com/press-release/tronc-inc-statement-on-shooting-in-annapolis-maryland-20180628-01308 |website=NASDAQ |accessdate=June 28, 2018|date=June 28, 2018}} The owner of the Capital Gazette created a fund for the families, victims, and survivors of the shooting, in addition to a scholarship memorial fund for journalism students.{{Cite news|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-capital-gazette-fundraiser-20180629-story.html|title=Capital Gazette owner creates fund for shooting victims, families and scholarship for journalism students|last=Campbell|first=Colin|work=baltimoresun.com|access-date=2018-07-08|language=en-US}} A separate [[GoFundMe]] fundraiser, created by a [[Bloomberg Government]] reporter hit the initial target and has grown to almost $200,000 by July 1.{{Cite news|url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-annapolis-shooting-gofundme-fundraiser-20180628-story.html|title=D.C. journalist aims to raise $200,000 for Capital Gazette shooting victims through GoFundMe|last=Mirabella|first=Lorraine|work=baltimoresun.com|access-date=2018-07-08|language=en-US}} Reporters for ''The Capital'' and ''Gazette'' began coverage of the shooting as it happened, from the newsroom and while returning from the field. Despite the shooting, journalists and staff at ''The Capital'' insisted on putting out the next edition of their paper only hours after the fatal shootings.{{cite news |author=Ed Pilkington, Ben Jacobs, and Kate Lyons |date=June 29, 2018 |title='We're putting out a damn paper’ - Capital Gazette publishes despite attack |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/jun/28/maryland-annapolis-newspaper-shooting-capital-gazette-publish |work=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=June 29, 2018}} The edition's opinion page was left blank to commemorate the victims, with the exception of a small note stating that the staff members "are speechless".{{cite news |date=June 29, 2018 |title="Speechless": Capital Gazette opinion page left blank after deadly shooting |url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/annapolis-shooting-capital-gazette-opinion-page-blank-today-2018-06-29/ |publisher=CBS News |accessdate=June 29, 2018}} On July 1, ''The Capital'' published an editorial, signed by its entire staff of reporters and editors, thanking the citizens of Annapolis and Anne Arundel County for their support following the shooting.{{cite web |title=Our Say: Thank you. We will not forget. |url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/opinion/our_say/ac-ce-our-say-20180630-story.html |website=capitalgazette.com |accessdate=3 July 2018}} === Vigils and memorials === Colleagues, friends, and family members of the deceased victims held a candlelit vigil on the streets of Annapolis on June 29 to honor the deceased. Capital Gazette reporter Phil Davis read the names of the deceased, and told the crowds that they were here "to honor who (the victims) were and what their families did not have to go through".{{Cite web|url=https://wtop.com/anne-arundel-county/2018/06/vigil-honors-victims-families-of-capital-gazette-shooting/slide/1/|title=Vigil honors victims, families of Capital Gazette shooting {{!}} WTOP|website=wtop.com|language=en-US|access-date=June 30, 2018}} On July 2, Annapolis mayor [[Gavin Buckley]] announced that the city planned to hold a summer music festival that will act as a celebration of [[freedom of the press in the United States|the freedom of the press]] and as a memorial for the journalists who were killed.{{cite web |last1=Ohl |first1=Danielle |title=Annapolis mayor planning press freedom festival to honor Capital Gazette shooting victims |url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/news/annapolis/ac-cn-annapolis-press-freedom-20180702-story.html |website=capitalgazette.com |accessdate=3 July 2018}} The concert was held on July 28 under the title ''Annapolis Rising: A Benefit for The Capital Gazette and Free Press''. The event featured performances by the rock bands [[Good Charlotte]] and [[Less Than Jake]], a presentation by comedian [[Jordan Klepper]], and a speech by ''Washington Post'' editor-in-chief [[Martin Baron]].{{cite web |last1=Furgurson III |first1=E.B. |title=Annapolis joins together to honor Capital Gazette victims, freedom of the press |url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/news/annapolis/ac-cn-annapolis-rising-20180728-story.html |website=capitalgazette.com |accessdate=2 August 2018}} Proceeds from this event will be used to benefit a fund established for the victims and survivors, as well as journalism scholarships.{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8465053/good-charlotte-benefit-concert-capital-gazette-shooting|title=Good Charlotte to Headline Benefit Concert for 5 Killed in Capital Gazette Shooting|work=Billboard|access-date=2018-07-11}} On July 3, the equipment manager of the [[Washington Capitals]], the [[2017-18 NHL season|2018]] [[Stanley Cup]] champions, brought the Stanley Cup to the Capital Gazette's temporary office to [[Stanley Cup#As a morale booster|boost the employees' morale]].{{cite web |last1=Wagner |first1=Bill |title=Stanley Cup visits the temporary Capital Gazette office |url=http://www.capitalgazette.com/sports/ac-cs-cup-to-cap-20180703-story.html |website=''Capital Gazette'' |accessdate=6 July 2018 |date=3 July 2018}}{{cite web |last1=Allen |first1=Scott |title=The Stanley Cup visited the Capital Gazette’s temporary office in Annapolis |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/dc-sports-bog/wp/2018/07/03/the-stanley-cup-visited-the-capital-gazettes-temporary-office-in-annapolis/?utm_term=.fdc01431c688 |website=''[[The Washington Post]]'' |accessdate=6 July 2018 |date=3 July 2018}} == See also == * [[Charlie Hebdo shooting|''Charlie Hebdo'' shooting]] * [[Aberdeen, Maryland shooting]] * [[Mass shootings in the United States]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://170.99.108.1/appellate/unreportedopinions/2015/2281s13.pdf ''Jarrod W. Ramos v. Eric Thomas Hartley, et al.''] Unreported in the Court of Special Appeals of Maryland, No. 2281, September Term, 2013 [[Category:2018 in Maryland]] [[Category:2018 mass shootings in the United States]] [[Category:Annapolis, Maryland]] [[Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in the United States]] [[Category:Workplace violence in the United States]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Maryland]] [[Category:June 2018 crimes in the United States]] [[Category:Journalists killed in the United States]] [[Category:Mass shootings in the United States]] [[Category:Tribune Publishing]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2018]] [[Category:Attacks in the United States in 2018]]
